channel.title: LatAm Prompt News Digest
channel.description: A daily digest of curated Latin American news.

item.title: LatAm Prompt News Digest - August 22, 2025
item.author: LatAm Prompt News Feed
item.description:
They Set Out to Find the American Dream. They’re Stuck in a Mexican Nightmare. — The Wall Street Journal

Cesar Atencio and Lina Arias wanted a better life. Instead, they faced gangs, kidnappers and a closed border. Their journey toward the U.S. shows a region reshaped and a dream reimagined.

Fleeing Maduro then Trump, Venezuelans seek refuge in Spain — Reuters

Fleeing Maduro then Trump, Venezuelans seek refuge in Spain

She's cared for America's elderly for decades. Trump wants her gone by Sept. 8 — NPR

The Trump administration has moved to end temporary protected status for immigrants from Honduras and other countries. Among them are health care workers tending to older and disabled people.

Why Mexicans love Japan and Korea — The Economist

Drama, language and music in one direction; rising numbers of Mexican tourists in the other

Climate change threatens an Andean ski boom — The Economist

The industry is melting just as it was starting to take off again

The new fears of Cubans in Florida — The Economist

The privileged status they have enjoyed since the cold war is slipping away

After 20 years in power, Bolivia’s socialists crash out of it — The Economist

That was not the only surprise in the general election’s first round
